subject: [Info] Amazon reviews copyright license
text:
"you grant Amazon a nonexclusive, royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, and fully sublicensable right to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, and display such content throughout the world in any media."
https://github.com/tosdr/tosback2/blob/265e49bf24a91076495ce1fddf279c4638421a66/crawl/amazon.com/Conditions%20of%20Use.txt#L85

should compare this to what other services do, but at first sight it seems ok to me. it's good that it's nonexclusive, and in the next sentence they say they may use your display name in connection to it, so it seems they are really just saying they may reproduce the reviews you post.

not sure if this royalty-free license would allow them to sell any information you submit into your account to third parties, it seems to be mostly about reviews.
